definition: residence/(coll.) to stay in at home/to hang around at home
(prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just

sentences.english: Most gardens in Suzhou used to be private residences.
sentences.chinese: 苏州的大多数园林过去是私人宅第。

sentences.english: When he was a child, his family lived in a sprawling mansion.
sentences.chinese: 还在幼年时，他的家庭就居住在一片广大的宅第之中。

sentences.english: There is a great country house surrounded by any goodyoneor.
sentences.chinese: 那儿是一所庄园大宅第。

sentences.english: The ancient mansion spoke to me of by gone days.
sentences.chinese: 古老的宅第对我诉说逝去的岁月年华。

sentences.english: And where be our family mansions and estates?
sentences.chinese: 还有，我们家族的宅第和房产在哪儿呢？

sentences.english: The manor is a marble house surrounded by a beautiful garden.
sentences.chinese: 庄园主宅第是一栋环抱在美丽的花园中的大理石房子。

sentences.english: Wide bright gate has only official can use times of grade curtilage .
sentences.chinese: 广亮大门只有有官位品级的宅第方可使用。

sentences.english: A mansion is a real big house with many bedrooms and several bathrooms.
sentences.chinese: 宅第是非常大的房子，有许多卧室和几个浴室。

sentences.english: Her family owned a grand house on a giant ranch.
sentences.chinese: 她家在一个大农场上有一所壮观的宅第。

sentences.english: There is a large country house surrounded by a manor.
sentences.chinese: 那儿是一所庄园大宅第。

sentences.english: The Keller homestead, where the family lived, was a few steps from our little rose-bower.
sentences.chinese: 凯勒家的宅第距我们家的玫瑰小凉亭只有几步之遥。
